title: Someone Asked Their Group Chat To Look After Their Chocolate Milk And Now People Are Testing Their Friends - BuzzFeed News

Twitter: @robmyplug ID: 10625630 2. Someone then proceeded to ‚Äúspill‚Äù the milk. Diglett then returned and asked where his milk was. Via Twitter: @robmyplug ID: 10625606 3. Perez, an 18-year-old from San Jose, California, shared the exchange on Twitter, where it was retweeted more than 7,000 times. 
‚Äî …æ…ë…æi_favi_itzme (@robmyplug) ID: 10625660 4. Perez told BuzzFeed News that as soon as diglett sent the image, he and his other friends went along with it because they immediately knew it was a reference to the Chocolate Milk Threads meme that started on 4chan in 2008. View this image ‚Ä∫ 
knowyourmeme.com ID: 10625725 5. According to KnowYourMeme , the meme usually starts with someone sharing an image of a glass of chocolate milk and asking others to ‚Äúwatch it‚Äù in their absence. People then agree or post an image of a spilled glass, sometimes with a controversial opinion that results in them reportedly being banned. View this image ‚Ä∫ 
knowyourmeme.com ID: 10625703 6. Other people then started doing the same in their group chats. Several of the exchange also went viral on Twitter. I leave my milk for 5 minutes...
